concept.title: Content reuse
concept.shortdesc: Learn about best practices of reusing content with conrefs and keyrefs to avoid problems with localization.

section.title: Handling conrefs
section.p:
DITA lets you easily reuse content using the conref attribute. Example of content referencing in DITA
Example of using the conref attribute to reuse content between topics

Improper use of content referencing can lead to translation errors (such as wrong gramamtical forms or text not matching the context). To avoid such errors, follow these rules:
Don't use conrefs for incomplete phrases. Instead, use them to reference whole sentences or larger fragments.
Avoid excessive content reuse. This may make it harder for translators to know the context of translated text.

section.title: Handling keyrefs
section.p: Keyrefs can be used for standard text or content that can change, such as product names.

When used improperly, keyrefs can also lead to translation errors. You can avoid them by using these tips:
Use keyrefs for non-declinable terms, such as product names or UI terms.
Avoid using keyrefs for common nouns.
Treat keyrefs as proper nouns and don't precede them with articles.
section.note: To avoid translation errors, it may be a good idea to resolve all conrefs and keyrefs before localizing your project.
